name: Olfrid Battle-Born

aspects.high_concept: Wealthy Patriarch of the Battle-Born Clan and Imperial Loyalist
aspects.trouble: Proud and Politically Entangled – Puts Family and Empire Above All
other_aspects: Influential Elder of Whiterun (Pulls Strings Behind the Scenes)
Quick to Bribe or Bully to Maintain His Family's Status
Secret Thieves Guild Benefactor (covertly aids their foothold in Whiterun)

stunts: Well-Connected: +2 to Contacts when finding information or leverage in Whiterun or Imperial circles.
Gold Greases Wheels: +2 to Resources when attempting to bribe officials or pay for a favor.

trust_clock.description: Represents Olfrid's trust in (or dependence on) the party – completing jobs for him or aiding Imperial cause raises this.

relationships.Battle-Born Clan: Patriarch (family comes first; includes son Idolaf and others)
relationships.Gray-Mane Clan: Bitter rivals in Whiterun (deep feud, especially over Thorald's fate)
relationships.Imperial Legion: Strong supporter and informant (his family favors the Empire in the Civil War)
relationships.Thieves Guild: Discreet business partner (provides cover and contacts, expects a cut of profits)
relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Political ally, tries to influence the Jarl to favor the Empire

personality_notes.speaking_style: Confident, boisterous when among friends, but condescending toward those of lower status. He often boasts of his connections and wealth. Can be charming in a transactional way.
motivations: Keep the Battle-Born clan in power and wealth within Whiterun
See Skyrim firmly aligned with the Empire (both for ideology and profit)
Undermine the Gray-Manes and any Stormcloak sympathizers in the hold
fears: Stormcloaks triumphing and stripping his family of privilege
Losing any of his children or family honor in the conflict
His secret dealings (with the Thieves Guild, etc.) coming to light and ruining his reputation
quirks: Frequently polishes a family signet ring on his finger while talking, especially when scheming
Casually drops names of powerful friends ("General Tullius and I…") to impress listeners
Adopts a grandfatherly tone with young people he wants to sway, calling men 'lad' and women 'lass'

combat_tactics: Olfrid avoids direct combat whenever possible—he's no glory-seeking warrior. If cornered, he is surprisingly handy with a sword (having trained in younger days as most Nords do), but will more likely attempt to bargain or threaten using his influence. In a fight, he might call for guards or try to escape. He's far more dangerous in a political arena than on a battlefield.
scene_triggers: Battle-Born vs Gray-Mane argument when the party first visits Whiterun's market
Seeking his help or information (he will help for a price or favor in return)
Thieves Guild job hand-offs or negotiations (if the party works with the Guild in Whiterun)
Civil War allegiance discussions (Olfrid lobbying for Imperial support in Whiterun)
